reviews.text: I have stayed at Chlosterhof Hotel for couple of nights. The hotel has got beautiful views on the Rein river. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms (I had a suite) spacious but somewhat dark and seemed like most of them had balconies. The food was really good (although I didn't have time to try their breakfast).
reviews.title: Nice hotel in nice little town

reviews.text: The only down side for me was that my room was on the town centre side and I heard church bells rining all night (every half an hour or even every 15 minutes) which disturbed my sleep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you approach the town from the other side of the Rhine, you notice this ugly building between all the ancient ones. Well, that is the hotel. Once inside, it gets much better. Some rooms have balconies with Rhine views, others of the town. Stein am Rhein is a small town, so everything is in walking distance. The train station is on the other side of the river, a 15-minute walk. The hotel has a nice pool with daylight, not too small and not too cold. There is also a sauna and solarium. The hotel bar is strange indeed, with integrated dancefloor and disco lights. On that evening we were the only guests until some others arrived (it was around 10.30 p.m., what you would expect to be a typical hotel bar hour). Breakfast with a wide choice of everything, unusual range of newspapers with breakfast; at least 5 or 6 different ones.
reviews.title: Ugly outside, nice inside
Odd Hotel Odd location
reviews.text: Hotels seems to used a lot for seminars, they have lots of meeting rooms of different size, but nothing going on when we were there.

In general the hotel is pretty good, even though the decor and furnishings are old fashioned. The location is great, just next to the old town, and the view of the river is spectacular. The breakfast buffet is good, and the underground parking garage is convenient. The staff could be quite a bit more friendly, but what really lets the place down is that they allow smoking in the bar! I was very much suprised by this, especially in a country like Switzerland. I was told that as the bar was in an enclosed area, smoking was allowed. However, I think that is very inconsiderate to other guests, and certainly put my colleagues and me totally off using the bar.
reviews.title: Good but .......!

reviews.text: I arrived quite late after a drive down from the alps,i was greetted by a very nice reception person,my room was lovely and very large,everything was in excellent condition and very clean.Parking I was surprised was an additional fees, I parked around back but had to feed the meter by 8;30 am.I ended up in the underground parking area by mistake,had a look around,I think it the nicest parking garage I've seen,really,probably worth the 20sf I think it was.
reviews.title: Back in time with all the modern conviences!

reviews.text: I had an excellent sleep ,the breakfast area which overlooks the river and also has a very nice courtyard was almost empty on my Saturday morning visit,the waitresses were friendly and helpful, and I found a very good selection, the coffee was exceptional.

It needs air conditioning.
reviews.text: The hotel is only steps from the medieval town of Stein am Rhine,even on a rainy Saturday morning it was pleasant ,a lively farmers market was taking place in the main courtyard area .

I also ventured to Werd island ,which is only minutes away by car it`s home to Franciscan Friers has a lovely chapel and a labyrinth I understand the history dates back to 5000bc ,a lovely place to visit you have to cross a 300-400 ft wooden bridge .AsI was just passing through I found this a very nice area to visit and I look forward to spending more time here in the future .
reviews.title: location location location

reviews.text: This hotel certainly has a few assets: The location, only separated from the Rhine by a walkway and it’s two minutes walk to the historic center of Stein am Rhein. The rooms are larger than usual and they are equipped with a Nespresso coffee maker. I’ve not tried the indoor pool.
reviews.title: Mixed bag

reviews.text: Chlosterhof means monastery yard. Only sounds historic / romantic as Chlosterhof is an ugly concrete building. More like a prison yard as plants and flowers are also missing, both inside and outside the hotel. Only a very few rooms face the Rhine, most overlook streets and parking lots. There is some lateral river view from rooms higher up, then again be careful with the top floor which is under the roof and gets pretty hot in summer - no air conditioning. Rooms are equipped with dark furniture, in particular a massive four-poster bed. My bed was very short and creaking each time I turned around. Lighting was poor around to sofa, no chance for reading. Rooms and bathrooms are partly renovated but still have a 1970-feel. The LCD TV is not great - just 23 inches and poor picture quality.
reviews.title: ... nice place to stay ... with fields for improvement ...

reviews.text: Breakfast was far from elaborate with no hot items, mostly pre-packed choices and paper napkins – you get the picture. Staff was obviously told to be friendly and attentive. So they tried to smile while waiting for their shift to end.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Great Little Town

reviews.text: Despite the nice location, this is just another generic business hotel mainly used for seminars and meetings. For the CHF 250 (single with breakfast) charged, they have to try much harder. Better value alternatives in the area include Krone Gottlieben and Bad Horn (both on the lake) or Karthause Ittingen (for real monastery feeling).

reviews.text: We reserved a normal room, but because of our baby they gave us an upgrade to a huge suite. The service was exellent and the food we had for dinner good. Breakfast might need some improvements.
